prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: My guide. This industrious young man is both a monk in training and a Khura'inese tour guide.
Character 1
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 2
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensic investigator.
Character 3
Name: Tahrust Inmee
Description: Khura'inist high priest in charge of the rites of Lady Kee'ra. Killed during the Purification Rite. Has a clergyman's mark on his brow.
Character 4
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 5
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last moments of the dead.
Character 6
Name: Puhray Zeh'lot
Description: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
Character 7
Name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
Description: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.
Character 8
Name: Beh'leeb Inmee
Description: Widow of the victim. She usually plays the part of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists. It reads: The Purification Rite is a three-part ceremony held when the moon is directly over the summit of Mt. Poniponi. It begins with the Transformation Rite. The high priest reads scripture dons the robes of Lady Kee'ra, which have been purified with incense. Next is the Rite of Water, in which the priestess enters the spring dressed as Lady Kee'ra, and the high priest purifies both Lady Kee'ra and her dagger. The ceremony ends with the Rite of Fire, in which the priestess circles the sacred flames to purify her soul. The two then devote themselves to prayer until the rite comes to a close two days later at noontime.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things. [caption] It reads: - Lady Kee'ra Returns to Battle Rebels - The Lady Kee'ra-like figure that appeared two years ago remains a mystery. Some town elders see her as Lady Kee'ra in the flesh. Such rumors are fueling the enthusiasm for today's Purification Rite. - Today's Purification Rite - The thick, white ice that froze the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion until yesterday has melted. The rite can now go on as planned. We give thanks for the blessings of the Holy Mother and Lady Kee'ra. Hap'piraki! - Escaped Prisoner Alert! - Police are asking the kingdom's subjects to be on the lookout for a male insurgent who escaped from Royal Penitentiary No. 4 yesterday. - Weather Forecast - The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight.
Evidence 3
Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 4
Name: Ritual Curtain
Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.
Evidence 5
Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.
Evidence 6
Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.
Evidence 7
Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.
Evidence 8
Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.
Evidence 9
Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.
Evidence 10
Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.
Evidence 11
Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area. Mt. Poniponi is 2298 meters tall and to the west. The Inner Sanctum is 2310 meters tall and to the east.
Evidence 12
Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.
Evidence 13
Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.
Evidence 14
Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.
Evidence 15
Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
Evidence 16
Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.
Evidence 17
Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 18
Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.
Evidence 19
Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.
Evidence 20
Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.
Evidence 21
Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.
Evidence 22
Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.
Evidence 23
Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidence 24
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.
Evidence 25
Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.
Evidence 26
Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.
Evidence 27
Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: That night, I was up at the top of Mt. Poniponi, the mountain next to the Inner Sanctum.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 1
Testimony: I hate crowds, so I climbed up there to pray in peace
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 2
Testimony: I know it's a no-no, but since there was no one around...
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 3
Testimony: ...I used my binoculars to spy on the rite at the Inner Sanctum.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 4
Testimony: That's when I saw the accused... stab the high priest with a dagger!
Person: Ihmus

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let's start by looking at the evidence and testimonies provided.

First, I'll list out the evidence and testimonies to get a clear picture.

**Evidence:**
- **0:** Attorney's Badge
- **1:** Rites Guide
- **2:** May 9th Newspaper
- **3:** Tahrust's Autopsy Report
- **4:** Ritual Curtain
- **5:** Bloodstained Letter
- **6:** Sanctum Prayer Flags
- **7:** Inner Sanctum Photo
- **8:** Maya's Statement
- **9:** Lady Kee'ra's Warning
- **10:** Warbaa'd Arrow
- **11:** Mountain Range Poster
- **12:** Envelope
- **13:** Wanted Poster
- **14:** Plumed Punisher Strap
- **15:** Inner Sanctum Diagram
- **16:** Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
- **17:** Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
- **18:** Warbaa'd Dagger
- **19:** Brand New Flag
- **20:** Nahmanda Flower
- **21:** Beh'leeb's Statement
- **22:** Family Photo
- **23:** Tome of Secrets
- **24:** Dhurke's Law Book
- **25:** Golden Orb
- **26:** Rebel Hideout Photo
- **27:** Warbaa'd Statue

**Testimonies:**
- **0:** Ihmus claims to have been on Mt. Poniponi, spying on the rite with binoculars, and saw the accused stab the high priest.
- **1:** Ihmus says he hates crowds and climbed the mountain to pray.
- **2:** He admits he used binoculars to watch the rite.
- **3:** He claims to have seen the accused stab the high priest.

Now, I'll look for contradictions between evidence and testimony.

Looking at **Testimony 3**, Ihmus says he saw the accused stab the high priest with a dagger. Now, I'll check the evidence related to the stabbing and the dagger.

**Evidence 3:** Tahrust's Autopsy Report states the cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.

**Evidence 18:** Warbaa'd Dagger is described as a dagger modeled after a warbaa'd, said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.

**Testimony 3** mentions the accused used a dagger to stab the high priest. However, **Evidence 18** suggests the dagger is a specific one used by Lady Kee'ra. If the dagger was indeed the Warbaa'd Dagger, its presence and usage would tie back to Lady Kee'ra, potentially contradicting the accusation against the defendant if there's evidence the dagger was not present or was used differently.

But wait, **Evidence 10:** Warbaa'd Arrow was found near the high priest's home, resembling the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra.

If the dagger and arrow are both linked to Lady Kee'ra, but the testimony says the accused used a dagger, this might not directly contradict unless there's evidence the dagger was not used or the arrow was the actual weapon.

Looking further, **Evidence 7:** Inner Sanctum Photo shows the high priest's body, a shoveled area, and a broken lantern. If the lantern was broken, it could imply a struggle or alternative weapon use, which might contradict the testimony about the dagger.

However, **Testimony 3** specifically mentions a dagger, and **Evidence 18** confirms the dagger's existence. This doesn't necessarily contradict unless there's evidence the dagger wasn't the murder weapon.

Wait, **Testimony 3** says the accused used a dagger, and **Evidence 18** is about the dagger. So they seem to align rather than contradict.

Let's look elsewhere. **Testimony 0-4** describe Ihmus's location and actions. **Evidence 11:** Mountain Range Poster shows the layout, and **Evidence 15:** Inner Sanctum Diagram shows where Maya and the high priest were.

If Ihmus was on Mt. Poniponi, could he have seen the stabbing? The distance and visibility might contradict his testimony. But without specific evidence on visibility, it's hard to say.

Another angle: **Evidence 5:** Bloodstained Letter found at the Inner Sanctum. If the letter's contents contradict the stabbing method or timing, it could contradict the testimony.

Alternatively, **Evidence 8:** Maya's Statement says the spring water was already red when they arrived. If the stabbing happened earlier, it contradicts the testimony about the timing.

But the testimony says Ihmus saw the stabbing during the rite, which aligns with Maya's statement if the rite was ongoing.

Perhaps **Evidence 7:** Inner Sanctum Photo shows a broken lantern. If the lantern's state suggests a different cause of death or time, it could contradict the testimony.

But I'm not seeing a direct contradiction yet.

Wait, **Testimony 3** says the accused used a dagger, and **Evidence 18** is the dagger. This seems to support, not contradict.

Maybe **Testimony 2** about using binoculars. If **Evidence 11:** Mountain Range Poster shows the distance from Mt. Poniponi to Inner Sanctum is too far for clear viewing, even with binoculars, that would contradict his ability to see the stabbing clearly.

But without exact distances, it's speculative.

Alternatively, **Evidence 4:** Ritual Curtain was supposed to isolate the sanctum. If the curtain was intact, Ihmus couldn't have seen inside, contradicting his testimony.

But **Evidence 4** says the entrance was shut, but not necessarily that the entire area was obscured. Maybe there were openings.

In conclusion, the most direct contradiction is between **Testimony 3** and **Evidence 18**, as the dagger's presence aligns with the testimony, but if there's evidence the dagger wasn't used or was elsewhere, that would contradict. However, based on the given information, they seem to support each other, so I might need to reconsider.

Perhaps **Testimony 3** and **Evidence 5:** If the Bloodstained Letter indicates the high priest was dead before the rite, contradicting the testimony that the stabbing occurred during the rite.

But **Evidence 3:** Autopsy Report says the death was during the rite, aligning with the testimony.

I think I need to choose **Testimony 3** and **Evidence 7:** If the photo shows no signs of a struggle with a dagger, but the testimony claims a stabbing, that could contradict. However, without explicit evidence, it's a stretch.

Given the information, I'll go with **Testimony 3** and **Evidence 18**, assuming they support each other, but perhaps the dagger's origin or presence contradicts the accusation.

Wait, no, that doesn't contradict. I need a clearer contradiction. Maybe **Testimony 3** claims the stabbing happened during the rite, but **Evidence 3:** Autopsy Report says the wound was delivered elsewhere or at a different time.

But **Evidence 3** says the death was during the rite, so they align.

Perhaps **Testimony 3** and **Evidence 10:** The Warbaa'd Arrow was found, suggesting an alternative weapon, contradicting the dagger claim.

But both could be present; the dagger was the murder weapon, and the arrow was found near the home.

I think the best contradiction is between **Testimony 3** and **Evidence 18**, as the dagger's presence supports the testimony, but if there's evidence the dagger wasn't used, that would contradict. However, based on the given info, they align.

I might need to conclude with the most fitting pair.
</think>

Person: Ihmus
Testimony 1

Person: Ihmus
Testimony 2
Testimony: She was just a shadow, but I could tell it was the accused, reverse-gripping that dagger!
Person: Ihmus

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, so I need to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me start by looking at the evidence and testimonies provided.

First, I'll list out the evidence and testimonies to get a clear picture.

**Evidence:**
1. Attorney's Badge - My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
2. Rites Guide - Details the Purification Rite, including the Transformation Rite, Rite of Water, and Rite of Fire.
3. May 9th Newspaper - Reports on the weather, Lady Kee'ra's activities, and an escaped prisoner.
4. Tahrust's Autopsy Report - Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.
5. Ritual Curtain - A curtain around the Inner Sanctum, isolating it during the rite. The entrance was shut.
6. Bloodstained Letter - Found at the Inner Sanctum with a large bloodstain.
7. Sanctum Prayer Flags - Found outside the ritual curtain, sewn into a long banner.
8. Inner Sanctum Photo - Shows the high priest's body, shoveled-out snow, and a broken lantern.
9. Maya's Statement - On the day of the rite, the spring water was already red when she and the high priest arrived.
10. Lady Kee'ra's Warning - A warning to the high priest, delivered by someone who could enter the priest's home.
11. Warbaa'd Arrow - Resembles Lady Kee'ra's arrows, found near the high priest's home.
12. Mountain Range Poster - Shows the layout of the Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi.
13. Envelope - Addressed to the high priest with three unusual holes.
14. Wanted Poster - Describes an escaped prisoner with a reward.
15. Plumed Punisher Strap - Plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme.
16. Inner Sanctum Diagram - Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
17. Crime Photo (Zeh'lot) - Killed in the Plaza of Devotion with a peach-shaped tattoo.
18. Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report - Died from a spinal injury from a bladed weapon.
19. Warbaa'd Dagger - Modeled after a warbaa'd, said to be used by Lady Kee'ra.
20. Brand New Flag - Found at the Plaza of Devotion with writing.
21. Nahmanda Flower - Used to pay tribute to the departed.
22. Beh'leeb's Statement - About the Feast of Blessings before the rite.
23. Family Photo - Taken during the Feast of Blessings.
24. Tome of Secrets - Given to the Lady Kee'ra role in the Purification Rite.
25. Dhurke's Law Book - Branded with the Defiant Dragons mark.
26. Golden Orb - Key to the rebel hideout.
27. Rebel Hideout Photo - Shows the hideout with a luminol reaction near the entrance.
28. Warbaa'd Statue - Caused Zeh'lot's death, also a revolving door.

**Testimonies:**
1. Testimony 0 - Witness saw shadowy silhouettes against the ritual curtain during the rite.
2. Testimony 1 - The figures were created by the full moon on a clear, still night.
3. Testimony 2 - The witness could tell it was the accused, reverse-gripping a dagger.

Now, I need to find a contradiction between one evidence and one testimony.

Looking at Testimony 2, the witness claims to have seen the accused reverse-gripping a dagger. However, looking at Evidence 5, the Ritual Curtain was shut, isolating the Inner Sanctum. If the curtain was closed, it's unlikely the witness could clearly see the accused gripping the dagger. This seems contradictory.

So, the evidence (Ritual Curtain) suggests the area was isolated, making it hard for the witness to see the details described in the testimony.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I'm presented with a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I need to find a pair where an evidence and a testimony contradict each other. I'll start by carefully reviewing each evidence and testimony to understand their content and identify any discrepancies.

First, I'll go through the list of characters to get a sense of who's involved. There's Ahlbi Ur'gaid, the defendant; Maya Fey, a spirit medium; Ema Skye, a detective; Tahrust Inmee, the victim; Nahyuta Sahdmadhi, the prosecutor; Rayfa Padma Khura'in, the crown princess; Puhray Zeh'lot, an apprentice priest; Datz Are'bal, a suspicious character; and Beh'leeb Inmee, the victim's widow.

Next, I'll examine the evidences. There are 27 pieces of evidence, ranging from the Attorney's Badge to various reports, photos, and physical items like the Ritual Curtain and the Warbaa'd Dagger. Each evidence provides specific details about the crime scene, the victim, and potential suspects.

Now, I'll look at the testimonies. There are seven testimonies from Ihmus, who seems to be a witness or possibly a suspect. His statements include claims about not being at the Inner Sanctum, the impossibility of climbing the cliffs, and the locked gate.

I need to find a contradiction between an evidence and a testimony. Let's take testimony 3, where Ihmus says, "Besides, it woulda been impossible to get there in the first place!" He's arguing that it's impossible to reach the Inner Sanctum, possibly due to the environment or security. 

Looking at the evidence, the Ritual Curtain (Evidence 4) is described as isolating the sanctum from the outside world, with the entrance shut during the rite. This suggests that the area was sealed off, supporting Ihmus's claim that it was impossible to get there. However, if there's evidence that someone did manage to enter, that would contradict his testimony.

Upon reviewing the evidence, the Inner Sanctum Photo (Evidence 7) shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a broken lantern. This indicates that someone did indeed gain access, as there's evidence of disturbance and a violent act. Therefore, the presence of this photo contradicts Ihmus's testimony that it was impossible to get there.

So, the contradiction lies between Evidence 7 (Inner Sanctum Photo) and Testimony 3, where Ihmus claims it was impossible to reach the Inner Sanctum, while the photo shows that someone did.
</think>

Character 2
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensic investigator.
Character 3
Name: Tahrust Inmee
Description: Khura'inist high priest in charge of the rites of Lady Kee'ra. Killed during the Purification Rite. Has a clergyman's mark on his brow.
Character 4
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 5

Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last moments of the dead.

Description: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
Character 7
Name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
Description: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.

Evidence 0

Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists. It reads: The Purification Rite is a three-part ceremony held when the moon is directly over the summit of Mt. Poniponi. It begins with the Transformation Rite. The high priest reads scripture dons the robes of Lady Kee'ra, which have been purified with incense. Next is the Rite of Water, in which the priestess enters the spring dressed as Lady Kee'ra, and the high priest purifies both Lady Kee'ra and her dagger. The ceremony ends with the Rite of Fire, in which the priestess circles the sacred flames to purify her soul. The two then devote themselves to prayer until the rite comes to a close two days later at noontime.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things. [caption] It reads: - Lady Kee'ra Returns to Battle Rebels - The Lady Kee'ra-like figure that appeared two years ago remains a mystery. Some town elders see her as Lady Kee'ra in the flesh. Such rumors are fueling the enthusiasm for today's Purification Rite. - Today's Purification Rite - The thick, white ice that froze the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion until yesterday has melted. The rite can now go on as planned. We give thanks for the blessings of the Holy Mother and Lady Kee'ra. Hap'piraki! - Escaped Prisoner Alert! - Police are asking the kingdom's subjects to be on the lookout for a male insurgent who escaped from Royal Penitentiary No. 4 yesterday. - Weather Forecast - The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight.
